column4: if i use the ubuntu feisty fawn live cd on a windows machine, does the live cd automatically mount the windows drives?
i am trying to recover some files on a friend's computer
no i don't think so...
the gutsy CD's do.
you sure?
almost 100%.
the gutsy live cd mounts the windows drives automatically?
on my PC(which dualboots), when i installed 7.10, it automounted my XP Home drive, but i use the alternate install CD, but I can only imagine that means it would have mounted fine on a live CD.
hold on, i think I have a Live CD, I'll boot it on my PC and check
alright, thanks :)
any luck?
i just found it, its booting now.
yes, all i had to do was go to Computer, right click my windows drive and mount it, no chmodding, etcl.
Cool, it displays the windows drive automatically, right? All I have to do is right click and mount?
it did for me.
cool. and this is the gutsy live cd?
yes
thanks a million IndyGunFreak :)
np.. it worked i assume?
really appreciate it. yeah it worked. for some reason the feisty live cd also seems to mount the drives automatically
hmm, never had much luck with Feisty CD's automatically mounting them.
